Indeed, since the Hamiltonian $G$ commutes with $R_{\lambda}$; it thus follows that the states  $\vert \phi \rangle$ and $R^\dagger  \vert \phi \rangle$ have identical eigenvalues: If $ \vert \phi_E\rangle$ is an eigenstate of $G$ with $E\neq 0$,  $G\,|\phi_E\rangle = E \,|\phi_E\rangle$, then $G \,R^\dagger_{\lambda}  \,  |\phi_E\rangle = R^\dagger_{\lambda} \,G\, |\phi_E\rangle=E\,  R^\dagger_{\lambda} |\phi_E\rangle$,  and thus  $R^\dagger_{\lambda}  \,  |\phi_E\rangle$ is also an eigenstate  of $G$ with the same eigenvalue.
